item.title: I Tried Every Todo App and Ended Up With a .txt File - Alireza Bashiri
item.description: I‚Äôve tried them all. Notion, Todoist, Things 3, OmniFocus, Asana, Trello, Any.do, TickTick. I even built my own todo app once (spoiler: I never finished it). After years of productivity app hopping, I‚Äôm back to where I started: a plain text file called todo.txt.

item.title: Wikimedia Foundation Challenges UK Online Safety Act Regulations ‚Äì Wikimedia Foundation
item.description: UPDATE: On Monday, 11 August, the High Court of Justice dismissed the Wikimedia Foundation‚Äôs challenge to the UK‚Äôs Online Safety Act (OSA) Categorisation Regulations. While the decision does not provide the immediate legal protections for Wikipedia that we hoped for, the Court‚Äôs ruling emphasized the responsibility of Ofcom and the UK government to ensure Wikipedia‚Ä¶.

item.title: Build Master-Detail Pages in ASP.NET Core MVC ‚Äî Part 1 | BinaryIntellect Knowledge Base
item.description: Master-detail pages are a staple in many web applications, offering a structured way to display and manage related data. Developers can implement these pages using various approaches‚Äîserver-side, client-side, or hybrid techniques. Additionally, a wide range of third-party controls and plugins are available to simplify the process. However, for beginners, it's valuable to understand the underlying mechanics of master-detail interactions and how to build them from the ground up.

item.title: I Tried GitHub Spark For The First Time And This Happened!
item.description:
GitHub Spark is a fun GitHub tool that, given a prompt, makes your front-end application a reality! It seems like a convenient, low (or near-zero?) code way to get something prototyped and published to the Internet quite rapidly. Check it out!

item.title: Making a font of my handwriting ¬∑ Chameth.com
item.description: Recently I‚Äôve been on a small campaign to try to make my personal website more‚Ä¶ personal. Little ways to make it obvious it‚Äôs mine and personal, not just another piece of the boring corporate dystopia that is most of the web these days. I don‚Äôt quite want to fully regress to the Geocities era and fill the screen with animated under construction GIFs, but I do want to capture some of that vibe.

item.title: Logic and creativity
item.description: Recently I filled in a survey about the shape I see the the year as when imagining it. This is a topic I find interesting since my own experience when asking people this question is that it never fails to give interesting answers and usually an interesting discussion afterwards. I therefore took care to give detailed answers, and filled out the various other questions of the survey as well as I could. The final question, ‚ÄúDo you consider yourself more logically or creatively thinking?‚Äù, made me sigh, however.
